name: Holiday Inn Phoenix Downtown North

reviews.text: The room was nice and beds were comfortable. Very central location as we were there for baseball spring training so we were right in the middle of all of the stadiums. Some things that were annoying about the hotel: slow Wi-Fi, super cold pool and super hot hot tub (so my kids couldn't use either), parking is very limited in front of the hotel (but there is free parking about a block away) and the topper was that we requested a crib for our little guy and they did not have one available. We stayed for 7 nights and finally got a crib the last 2 nights after talking to the manager on the 4th night (after asking at the front desk every day). We travel quite often and I've never requested a crib and not gotten one. There was nothing terribly wrong with this hotel but since we have a young family that wants to use a pool and a crib, I will find a different hotel the next time we are in Phoenix.
reviews.title: Nice room, some annoyances

reviews.text: I have stayed at this hotel three times in the last 3 months. The location is great, close to downtown and very close to the light rail. The rooms on the downtown side have a very nice view of the downtown. Staff is friendly. The rooms are nicely decorated although the bathrooms are a little small. The parking is little difficult, with a very small parking lot and then a large parking structure around the corner. Overall for the money a very satisfactory stay.
reviews.title: great location for downtown

reviews.text: Great sevice at breakfast, but very plain food.
reviews.title: Excellent Service, Average Physical Plant

reviews.text: Can't open windows in room.
reviews.title: good for business travel didn't live up to promises - and no hot water!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Free WiFi, but a little slow.
reviews.title: A Great Hotel!

reviews.text: I had a nice stay at this Hollyday inn
reviews.title: It's nice Hollyday inn

reviews.text: Stuff is very nice and the rooms are very comfortable and quiet, the breakfast is only $8 what I consider a very affordable price. You will like it!
reviews.title: below expectations

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: i was staying here on business and my experience was poor. our company had been traveling around the country and staying in other holiday inns with good results.
reviews.title: pleasant surprise.

reviews.text: my hot water cut in and out, and stopped working on 3rd day. i called the front desk and they said they would fix it. the next morning i took another cold shower. i made another call and they said they would send maintenance. and that evening my shower didn't work at all.
reviews.title: Great staff, great food, great service.

reviews.text: the food and service at the restaurant was not very good. my friend actually felt sick afterwards from the nachos. the service was slow even though there was very few people there. the bartender was somewhat obnoxious. i also ordered the only local brew they had and he wasn't sure what i was talking about. and then failed to bring me a beer at all, which was strange to us.
reviews.title: Above expectations

reviews.text: The staff at this hotel generally did a good job and the rooms are very clean. Good internet connectivity except it seems to kick one off once a day. Parking in front is inadequate and they send you around to a hotel behind this one. It is easier to park at the ESA across the street.
reviews.title: Great Little Hotel

reviews.text: I was looking forward to my stay at this hotel as I read on the website it got recently remodeled - but what I experienced was one of my worst hotel stays ever and I will never return nor will my colleagues.
reviews.title: Never again - this is a 1* motel

reviews.text: Check-In:
reviews.title: What a WODERFUL experience

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Check-In was easy and quick, however my Platinum Status was not recognized. I knew from a colleague that they give Plats one free drink voucher per day - so I was surprised I didnt get anyhting. After check-in I asked and got them... .
reviews.title: Great location and good service

reviews.text: Room:
reviews.title: It was a very hospitable staff - most frioendly & always willing to assist our needs!

reviews.text: I love this hotel and it is the only place I stay when visiting Phoenix. The staff is always helpful and extremely courteous. I first started staying here 3 years ago and have never been anything less than thrilled. The low turnover of staff is a good indicator to me that people love working there. As a regular traveler (over 50% on the road), I have a pretty reasonable expectation around amenities -- this hotel exceeds my expectations.
reviews.title: Extraordinary service

reviews.text: Stay was satisfactory. The room I was in was was probably close to the kitchen because I was smelling some kind of cooking aroma from outside the door up to inside my room! Staff seemed friendly, room service closes at 9:30PM, which is inconvenient if you check in late as I did. Parking closer to the hotel is limited, but allowed to park on the curb as long as traffic is not obstructed.
reviews.title: It's okay.....

reviews.text: The worst customer service in the business. The hotel management and restaurant staff are rude and incompetent.
reviews.title: Horrible Customer Service

reviews.text: From the minute I walked in the door, the service at this hotel was extraordinary. Briana, at the front desk, juggles many tasks with ease. I had arrived early in the day, and there was no room available. In between greeting me, checking out someone else, and answering the phone, she took my bags and placed them in a secured room so that I could go for a walk.
reviews.title: Service is extraordinary

reviews.text: When I got to my room, I need to setup up my computer and get to work for a presentation the next day. The desk chair was stuck in position and I could not raise it to work at the desk. Stephanie from housekeeping got on it right away and within minutes I had a new desk chair. Stephanie also insisted on helping me up to my room with my bags because I had returned with a cup of coffee, so did not have enough hands. When I needed a light bulb replaced, that also happened very quickly. This wasn't because they were bored, as the hotel was close to full.
reviews.title: Close enough to downtown, far enough away...

aka: Holiday Inn Phoenix Downtown North Hotel
description: Welcome to our new Hotel in Downtown Phoenix, AZ Conveniently located just a block from the light rail, the new Holiday Inn Phoenix Downtown North is in the middle of the city's shopping and financial districts. Our Phoenix, AZ hotel offers convenient access to attractions and businesses which include Reach 11 Sports Complex, Horse Lovers Park, Heard Museum, US Airways Center, Chase Field, St. Joseph's Hospital the State Capitol, Xerox, and U-Haul Int'l. The Phoenix Convention Center is located just three miles and the Phoenix Sky Harbor Airport is within 9 miles from our smoke free hotel in Phoenix, both easily accessible by light rail. Our hotel offers a 24-hour business center and a meeting room for up to 30 guests as well as free high-speed Internet access. Lodging in our downtown Phoenix hotel offers our guests easy access to Phoenix's cultural attractions and multiple recreational activities. The University of Phoenix Stadium and Jobing.com arena are just minutes from our Phoenix hotel rooms. Our Phoenix accommodations offer an outdoor pool and a 24-hour fitness center for your use. Enjoy a delicious and satisfying meal at Morgan Tyler, our signature steakhouse, or visit the lobby for a cup of Starbucks coffee. Look again at the new Holiday Inn Phoenix Downtown North, and discover a great Phoenix hotel.
